definition: to cut short/extinct/to disappear/to vanish/absolutely/by no means
surname Mi/name of an ancient state

sentences.english: Don't tell us that these are some of the conferences "top secret" documents.
sentences.chinese: 可別說都是些什麼會議上的絕密文件噢。

sentences.english: This is the computer where (=by/on which) he has stolen top-secret documents.
sentences.chinese: 這就是他用來盜竊絕密文件的計算機。

sentences.english: Incident is collected at archives of punishment detect top-secret " bughouse talks about Guizhou mountain quite " .
sentences.chinese: 事件收錄於刑偵絕密檔案“黔嶺精神病院怪談”。

sentences.english: They threaten you to hand out a top-secret document?
sentences.chinese: 他們威脅你把一個絕密文件交出去？

sentences.english: He knew the physics department had taken on a confidential assignment.
sentences.chinese: 他知道物理學院已經接受了一項絕密的任務。

sentences.english: Records concerning Princess Rhianne Burke are highly classified.
sentences.chinese: 關於席安布敘克女王的記錄是絕密的。

sentences.english: But how do you go about putting top secret documents online without getting caught?
sentences.chinese: 但是怎樣才能在網上發佈絕密文件而不被抓到呢？

sentences.english: In 1955, the company's top-secret U2 reconnaissance aircraft made its first flight.
sentences.chinese: 1955年，該公司絕密的U2偵察機完成首次飛行。

sentences.english: Projects at the National Business Park will expand the area available for top-secret work. (Photo by Michael S. Williamson / The Washington Post)
sentences.chinese: 國家商務園的項目將擴張至其他適合絕密工作的區域。

sentences.english: Harry's job is to test top secret recipes.
sentences.chinese: 哈里的工作就是測試絕密的糖果配方。

definition: to be a real headache/to find sth a real headache/to beat one's brains
to spend effort/to take trouble/May I trouble you to...? (as part of polite request)/Please would you mind...?
to like to look good in the eyes of others/sensitive about how one is regarded by others/proud
to have one's spirits dampened/to feel disappointed
to err/to get sth wrong/to miscalculate/to misunderstand
